pros: There was always flexibility to go to class if there was a need. They never made you feel like you needed to put your job over your job. If there was a big exam they would allow you to leave or call in to get it done. There was never a conflict with balancing school with work and life. They were always constructive criticism when needed and praises when they were earned. The potential to grow within the college is one of the reasons to stay there for a long time. One never knows where you can end up if you stay there long enough. There is always room to move up in within the college.
cons: The size of the college forces you to just build relationships within the campus you work and unless you are working at the college level you really do not know anything about what goes on at the other campuses. There is a bit of rivalry between each of the campuses. Since I worked at the college level I was able to see all the rivalry and bickering between campuses. It’s as if each is fighting to gain daddy’s (Dr. Eduardo J. Padrón’s) affection and attention.

review_title: Poor Treatment of Adjuncts by Administration
pros: Well, we eventually do get a paycheck, right?
cons:
Steer clear of this school if you are looking to adjunct here. At some campuses I have had students in my classes who did not even speak English. Also if there are budget cuts, adjuncts bear most of the burden with lowered class loads. You can go from four classes to one, which is the school's tactic for avoiding paying unemployment. It is shameful that this school, which primarily services poor or low income students, does so on the backs of an adjunct teaching force that makes virtually lower than minimum wage. Even working a full adjunct schedule, four classes in the spring, fall, and one class in the summer amounts to about 22k a year which is  poverty line territory and certainly not an income to survive on in the Miami area.

New adjuncts might have to wait five to seven weeks to receive their first paychecks depending upon when HR and/or department submits paperwork or when data is entered into its PeopleSoft system.

I requested a readjusted whiteboard because of my height (I am 5'5"). As I was speaking to the class about this on the first day, the Wolfson president came into my class to greet the students and say that he would take care of it.  He never did so I had to stand in a chair every time I needed to write on the white board. I even volunteered to buy a lowered moveable whiteboard but management said they would not reimburse me. They did everything to make my teaching experience as inefficient as possible.

pros: amazing people, great opportunity, very friendly
cons: There is none! I really don't have anything to add

job_title: Capus Network Services Technician in Kendall, FL
pros: Depend on the department you work on the atmosphere will be different. Overall, it brings good things to the table in the fact that you can work where you go to school, this is if you go to school or are planning to continue your education or further up your career. They will help you achieve it, that is one of the good things that they do have. As a work study job or regular PT or FT employee.
cons: Again, depends on the department you work for and the people you have to deal with it. I worked for the college for around 12 years, ever since i got out of high school and started my engineering carrer. I worked in different departments. But what seems to be the same outcome on all the department. hypocrisy, back staving, taking behind your back to gain preference with higher ups and promotions, promotions will go by who is better friends with the boss than rather focus on what they can bring to the table. low wages and i mean low wages. very little incentive to grow within the college.

pros: Making a difference in shaping the future generations for those of us who are still passionate about teaching. There are many great teachers and administrators in spite of the rampant incompetence of certain people who are where they are because they have been at the college for many years or have risen through the ranks solely based on their connections rather than merit.
cons: No opportunity for advancement. Lots of politics and favoritism. Extremely unqualified employees in key areas that are clueless as to their job functions.

review_title: No Support Structure for Adjunct Professors
pros: It is an honor to work at the largest community college in the Nation. Working with commuter and immigrant students is such a treat. There's never a dull day in class. A lot of independence to design your own course and teach what you want.
cons: There is no support structure for adjunct professors. No group meeting, no introductions, no peer to peer support, no sharing of ideas, etc. You may never meet the other professors in your department that teach the same courses as you. You can expect to see office staff at the beginning of the course to receive documents and at the end when turning in documents. Pay is very low. $2,200 per course per semester. The salary is not enough of an incentive to provide more to the students as a teacher. Reading 150 reports is easier to read when making $500 a week than $500 biweekly, which is the case at MDC.

pros: Flexible. That's all. Pay is lower than full-timers get.
cons: No benefits. Full-time faculty does not get involved with adjuncts. Two separate cultures. You are dispensable. No guarantee that you have classes till last minute. Full-timers can take your classes if they want and you can't do anything about it. You get evaluated by students and Chairperson. Chairperson never is evaluated by adjuncts though there can be good and bad chairpersons. Adjuncts have no protection from abuses. Have seen Chairperson simply get back at adjuncts by not giving them classes and forcing them to resign. Many adjuncts on food stamps. MDC has 2/3 faculty as part-time. Academia's little dirty secret... Make money off adjunct slave labor and sweat shop treatment. No adjunct faculty union available.  When interviewing for full-time faculty position, get ready to watch cronyism, sexism, and a futile exercise, even if you are one damn great instructor (proven by repeated high grades in  student surveys).

pros:
1. New buildings and tech (Wolfson)
2. Very supportive department
3. SO MANY PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT OPPORTUNITIES. Tech training, student retention, just endless amounts of offerings for making you a better teacher
3. They use textbooks and they are good textbooks (macmillan)
4. a lot of freedom w class design and assignments
5. very motivated students
cons:
1. the pay is low (2.4k per course if you adjunct... for context UM is 3k min)
2. larger classes (25 cap)
3. You may have to teach "dual enroll" students, ie high school kids as young as 14 who are bratty and do not belong in a college class
4. The admin is working hard to prevent adjunct faculty from unionizing. 
5. NO benefits or decent healthcare

job_title: Front Desk Clerk in Miami, FL
pros: I wasn't flipping burgers. It was good for the first year I worked....I got interesting tasks on many occasions working with staff for events.
cons: It was once a great job worthy of 5 stars until expectations and responsibilities became intolerable. The position is disrespected by faculty, staff and, students. Working hours reduced to make room for a management position. Lack of identification.Pay is barely enough to justify gas or public transport if you work 15 hours a week or less. Retirement "benefits" is not good for students, money goes in, disappears and, you cant opt out. No advancement possible unless you know people or have a BA or greater.

review_title: They love you when you are doing good, but as soon as they get tired of you, theyll find a way to get rid of you.
job_title: Lab Technician- North Campus in Miami, FL
pros: Good experience with faculty. Lots of academic opportunities as a perk of working there (research, special events) if you put your own time in. There was a feeling of being a part of something bigger than yourself. I was very satisfied when I completed a project or suggested a way to improve an existing facility, however, management didnt share my enthusiasm.
cons: Managament basically owns your soul. The objective of the game is to keep them happy (whoever they may be) for as long as you can, in any way you can. If you rub someone the wrong way, they have influence to make your life impossible.

review_title: A top community college in the nation
job_title: Administrative Assistant IV in Miami, FL
pros: Excellent compensation and benefits. Good collaboration across the  College's eight campuses to achieve results. Competitive and driven faculty and staff.
cons: Little recognition is given for going above and beyond to achieve goals. Staff and administrators are assigned multiple disconnected  roles with limited training and the expectation  of perfect delivery. The Human Resources Department should revisit interviewing practices, so these are consistent across the campuses.

pros: Great job security, potential to meet really good and diverse people. Information is always at your fingertips and problems with customers can get solved very quickly. Great brand and school, has some great professors and is one of the best values for an accredited degree out there
cons: Part time employees never get overtime, may work extra one week but have to miss a day the next week. Raises are minimal and rare. It is difficult to get promoted or move to a better position. Usually, hiring committees already have favorites.

pros:
-Awesome People and Work Environment
-Good for starting out and building Work Experience
-Good Opportunities to Grow and Learn
-Ideal for younger individuals to work and study at the same time affording flexibility
- Great Benefits for Full-Time Employees
cons:
Hard To Become FT*(Full Time)
Mobility is Extremely Limited*
Low Pay*
Benefits are Limited For Part-Timers*

pros:
Good Fringe Benefits
Well-recognized Institution
Decent campus life, even for staff
Great staff; Co-workers tend to be nice to work with
Good office space; most all administrators have great offices
cons:
Too big of an institution to manage under the current managment style
Cronyism at an all time high; very difficult to achieve vertical promotion unless you know someone
Pay is embarassingly low
Lack of diversity in managerial staff.  For such a diverse institution, diversity in staff should be easily accomplished

job_title: Senior Systems Administrator in Miami, FL
pros: Time off in December, but every year they've taken days away that requires you to use vacation time even when college is closed.  Relaxed scheduling depending on department
cons: Pay is very low compared to other schools and private sector, very little chance to move up, low morale among most personnel, more managers than people actually working. Internal employees only get a 10% increase in pay for every level they move up (if they do) external hires make more than internal

review_title: Working for this company was a blessed and extremely learned experience.
pros: the perks to working here were the vast opportunities to climb the employment latter and the connections made with very important people in this institution. plus everyone is always open to help you and mentor you with any problem you may have.
cons: the cons to working here were few and far in between i would have like more hours though. besides that i have no complaints.

pros: Room for long-term growth if you are wiling to put forth the effort to network, seek professional development, and volunteer for events. Other pros include a great benefits package and an interesting community to work with and learn from.  Part-timers also gain free professional development programs through the college that will enable growth within the college and/or beyond.
cons: Not a place for those who are prone to complacent work habits. Working any position and doing the minimum required, while expecting promotions and rewards, will not end well. Those who remain professionally stagnant are quickly replaced by those who are willing to grow with the community and adapt new skills.

review_title: A formerly great community college now an also ran.
pros: The students. I absolutely loved my students. Most hardworking, lively nontraditional students.
cons: Far too many part-time staff and faculty are now shouldering the load of this once proud educational institution. They're overworked, underfunded and underpaid. They desperately need more FULL-TIME faculty and LESS administration.

pros: Its a great place to be if you are going to school. You meet lots of people and create great relationships.
cons: In orientation they encourage you to apply for full time positions but reality is that full time positions are getting cut and those that are in those positions don't plan to leave anytime soon. It doesn't give much opportunity to those young graduates.

review_title: Amazing Institution Depending on Your Department
pros: Some department chairs and administration really care about their students and think outside the box, making the educational experience very exciting and  enriching for both the student and the instructor.  Lots of freedom to be creative and try new things.
cons: Some department chairs and administration are obsessed with petty nonsense (but I suppose you get that at any institution).  One dean even went so far as to tell me I should "dress a little better".   (FYI I wore business casual clothing to work every day.)

job_title: Assistant Marketing Coordinator in Miami, FL
pros: It's a great job if you're still in school, they're very flexible with your hours and it's great work environment. Unlike a lot of universities, people who work at a college both faculty and staff for the most part enjoy what they do. It was a pleasure to work in the student services area helping the public.
cons: Not many benefits for Part-Time and difficult to break into Full-Time. (Been part-time for 9 yrs)

review_title: A great place to work with a friendly atmosphere.
pros: Working here was great because I was always engaged with the students and tutoring them in whatever STEM subject they needed. Company values are great and they truly do care about their employees. They did offer raises every 6 months as well as a retirement plan. Very flexible when it came to your scheduling.
cons:
Sometimes, the work place got very crowded which made it sometimes difficult to teach effectively.
No other cons.

pros: As a part-time employee you have flexible hours. You can wprk from either 8AM to 1 PM, or 11 AM to 4:30 PM.  However, my supervisor is even more flexible. His only concern is that there is always coverage in the office.
cons: Salaries are extremely low. There aren’t any merit salary raises. The only way you can get an increase is by furthering your education, like getting a Masters or PhD, or by changing positions. And don’t expect those increases to be high, because they're not!

pros: Pay is usually competitive. There are great opportunities to move up and internal candidate are usually given most consideration. You will usually always find a fellow employee willing to assist you in anything.
cons: Working with leadership is sometimes difficult. They will not always communicate clearly and you sometimes have to play guessing games. This can be frustrating since you may get blamed for something you had no idea about.

pros: You are working in a fast paced environment with excellent opportunities to develop students into a respectable understanding of Accounting concepts and practices. You are able to develop a skill set that is required to work with a multitude of students and their learning methodologies.
cons: Pay is not great at all and despite being with the company for years, you may not see a pay raise of over .30 every year.

pros: It has a very diverse student body.  Students come from all backgrounds and walks of life.  This provides an enriching environment for learning.  The employee package of benefits is generous and useful.
cons: Because it is a large educational complex--probably one of the largest in the nation--encompassing so many people as staff and students, it can be very bureaucratic and some processes can become slow and truly cumbersome.  Too much paperwork.

pros: I find that my coworkers are inspirational and supportive. Were it not for them, my success would not be at its best level.
cons: Part time offers no benefits and the current  self service software is not working well enough to assist student, therefore we have an overflow of applications not received and issues that are unresolved.

job_title: Office Assistant in North Miami, FL
pros: It is a very friendly environment and compared to other places of employment, it is practically stress free.  The supervisors are very understanding of their employees, and employees have a friendly and supportive accord with each other.
cons: The pay is horrible.  A little above minimum wage and not too many hours if you work part-time.  Lack of professionalism is also a problem.

review_title: It provided some experience but with very little pa and few chances for upward mobility
pros: It's nice to work and study at the same place. Its multi-cultural environment really helps you develop inter-personal skills and become a good communicator. Supervisors are fair.
cons: Very little pay. Very few chances for upward mobility. The Financial Aid office sometimes looks like a madhouse. There's a constant lack of funds for most necessary improvements. Students are spoon-fed too much; many employees can't even speak proper English.

pros: MDC is the largest public college in the United States and has the most internationally and ethnically diverse student population in the country. MDC is rated by the Chronicle of Higher Education as one of the best institutions to work for in the the country.
cons: MDC is a teaching institution and not a research institution. Course loads are high. However, students receive an excellent education from excellent professors dedicated to the art and science of teaching.

pros: I liked working there because you learn a lot, the job is very hands on. You have great people working there, a great place to work.
cons: Too many politics involved, however you can have a chance to grow within. The benefits not as good as they used to but better than working for a private institution.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Miami Shores, FL
pros: Excellent Work/live balance. Even though is a small company has a corporate structure and excellent management. Good for employees in the early stages of corporate structures.
cons: small company. even though it has a lot of potential to become big at this moment needs an injection of capital that takes the company to the next leve.

pros: Lots of good co-workers, interesting people who are personally invested. There are some pretty interesting things happening at MDC and the pay is good.
cons: As a part timer they have a strict 25/wk max and as with all their policies it is the responsibility of the employees to make sure they are in compliance. Because it is mostly part timers there is a bit of a high turn over.

job_title: Part Time Clerk in Miami, FL
pros: Good place to work if you are still in school.
cons: Can't make up hours. Don't feel like part of a team, at least in the department where I work. If you are a part-time employee be prepared to be excluded from meetings and events. Not informed of changes. Hardly any full-time positions. No advancement.

pros: The students are willing to learn.
cons: Everything else--on-boarding process takes up to 90 days! No access to Blackboard even if you already teach fully online courses elsewhere and/or have a Educational technology certificate. Adjuncts are the bottom of the barrel. Don't bother applying for job b/c someone is already lined up for them, and yes, most often these folks don't really have experience or qualification to be an administrator

review_title: Great place to start a career
pros: Unlike a lot of universities, people who work in community college both faculty and professors enjoy what they do. It was a pleasure to work in the student services offices handling with student issues.
cons: Not much room for growth within student services department. As a professor, best case scenario you become a department head, which is good too.

pros: It's a great job if you're still in school, they're very flexible with your hours and it's great work environment
cons: Low pay and won't let you go over 20 hours. Some of the learning resources supervisors are just unfair and will treat you poorly just because they don't like you.

pros: Great colleagues, a professional atmosphere, resources necessary to do your job effectively, and a great boss! Even the upper levels of administration were so professional and fair that I always felt as though I was valued as an employee.
cons: No real cons that I would mention.

review_title: I would NEVER reccomend any position at MDC to anyone.
pros: Sometimes flexible with schedule, if your a student working at MDC can benefit you.
cons: You will always be doing someone else's work which you will not be adequately compensated for nor will receive recognition for. Raises are close to impossible, they tack on duties that are not in your job description. If you are not full time you can not park in employee parking.

pros: My department was like family and so were the students. All departments collaborate and are friendly, for the most part. Overall team environment throughout the campus.
cons: Drop to 25 hour work weeks, "Politics", parking, and dealing with some really crazy parents on a daily basis.

pros: Technology in classrooms is good, staff support is usually helpful. Students are a pleasure to work with- they are generally glad to be going to school for an affordable value and take their education seriously, particularly the adult learners.
cons: Adjunct salary is pitiful. Even teaching 4 classes a semester (max of 9 classes per year), salary puts you below the poverty level.

job_title: Senior Academic Advisor in Miami, FL
pros:
-Opportunities for Growth
-Surprisingly a variety of opportunities and position that you don't expect at a former Community College
-Great Salaries compared to other higher ed institutions in Miami
-Employees look out for each other
cons:
-Very Disorganized 
-Toxic culture in Advisement Department
-HR doesn't really pay attention to what is going on

job_title: Part Time Clerk in Miami, FL
pros: You get to meet a lot of people who you can network with. The coworkers for the most part are very nice and you get free food every now and then.
cons: There is no opportunity of growth until you've been there 10 years or something crazy. Unfair wages for EVERYTHING they have you do.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Miami Springs, FL
pros: a multicultural environment where I have had the opportunity to learn about different cultures and to co-exist and respect
cons: lack of opportunities to grow and advance within the company, and low salaries

pros: So many opportunities for growth. While it is a very large institution, there is still a great sense of community among colleagues at different campuses. A great mission of affordable higher education to those who may not otherwise have access.
cons: None but to make the twenty word minimum I will encourage all employees to consider that the job is what you make it.

pros: Flexible teaching schedule, amazing dept. chair, motivated students, benefits, PD, grant work and other non-teaching opportunities for those faculty who want it.
cons: One:  despite support from dean and dept. chair, campus president refused a request by tenured faculty (me) for a year of UNPAID leave to raise her infant. Solution: resign to raise infant!

pros: Good hourly pay, no lots of supervision, great academic freedom.
cons:
Course load is unpredictable, pay days change every academic year (retention of 3 to 4 weeks). 
Limited to 3 classes per semester if it fits their guidelines (As to not have to give you benefits)

pros: Flexible schedule if you're a student, and decent amount of hours depending on how much work you're willing to do
cons: Administration is a mess; most of the time the questions you need answered are avoided because of lack of knowledge

pros:
Excellent atmosphere 
Great co workers 
Love the students
cons:
Not enough classes to teach especially if you are an adjunct Professor 
They only give your 2 classes .  If you go full time - you are in for a long wait before you get that but once you do - 4 classes are yours .

review_title: One of the best employers and loves to promote from within.
job_title: Public Safety Officer in Miami, FL
pros: Promotes from within and you can move horizontally career wise with nearly limitless variance in jobs.
cons: Salary below the market; The Chief Financial Officer is using the overall scarcity of jobs to his/her advantage and hold wages down.

pros: Relaxing environment, flexible hours. Nice people to work with overall.
cons: Lack of interest in supporting employees growth,  No interesting in promoting or hiring internally.

job_title: Director of Learning Services/Adjunct Professor in Miami, FL
pros: It is like working in UNO. Because all the countries in the world are represented there.
cons: Budget cut due to not enough money coming from state or federal government. this may result in cutting down employee benefits.

pros: Difficult to get fired. Can take classes at the college for free. Good work life balance.
cons: Completely political organization. Lack of understanding from executive level employees about atypical departments (i.e., non-academic departments). Pay is low (for area), benefits are nothing to write home about. Forced to "volunteer" about political issues (i.e., Amendment 8 rallying).

pros: Extremely rewarding to have been part of the ACCESS team. Since the office is small and there are only about 15 staff members, you get to know each other very well. Even after leaving the ACCESS Department, I still visit because of how much I care about the staff.
cons: Low wage, lack of mobility.

pros: Not stressful, very few tasks per week, minimal workload.
cons: Disorganized, very bad management techniques, some employees are less than qualified

pros: Diverse population; positive community; great parking space; lots of community interaction events; located in the middle of downtown; near shops, dining areas, businesses, and art district.
cons: Traffic jams. The transportation system is underdeveloped in comparison to the amount of people living in the greater Miami, therefore causing extended hours of traffic congestion.

pros: Supportive supervisors listen and understand faculty concerns
cons: Unstable for adjunct faculty, as classes are given and chosen first by full-time faculty.

review_title: If you're looking for great pay and horrible morals this is the place for you
pros:
Great pay and benefits 
Excellent students 
Good crisis management
cons: Politics of working here are very tough. Unless you went to Miami Dade previously, I guarantee you will not succeed here. Most of the administration prefers to hire inside their alum and don't really like consideration of outside idea which are current with a majority of innovative higher education institutions.

pros: Benefits. Students. Closed over the holiday season.
cons: A great deal of inbreedind. Antiquated registration and finance processes and systems even with migration to People Soft.

pros: Good people are few and far between but are present at occasion.
cons: Bureaucracy stunts growth and results, and the ultimate price of this  is paid to by students.

pros: I worked in Miami Dade while going to school there. I think its great for building experience.
cons: The bureaucracy in Miami Dade is a con. One document would have to go through so many layers, which would delay the process of getting it approved.

review_title: I wish I could work at MDC full-time!
pros: This is a wonderful opportunity to help students achieve their career goals.
cons: Limited enrollment can cause a class to be closed or your pay rate is reduced.

pros: Have a job, nice people, professional development, a lot of positions one can apply to, learn new skills and more
cons: Too much bureaucracy , do not care for students, worry about numbers, no creativity and do same old thing over and over

job_title: Assistant Store Manager in Miami, FL
pros: They are a group of professionals, that will take you to the next level of preparedness for the future.
cons: the pay to work for them still at minimum.

pros:
Opportunity to learn more everyday.
Co-workers and managers are helpful and friendly.
Makes you learn more about your College
cons:
Same thing to do all day.
Some people won't be friendly even when you help them.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Miami Springs, FL
pros: Great college programs, and excellent company to work for. Most departments are well interconnected which provides an overall working experience.
cons: unfortunately the majority of entry level positions are part-time. IT would be great if MDC could offer more development type of courses for their employees and even more certificates.

pros: Great place to work for while seeking a degree since they help with tuition and flexible work hours for current students.
cons: Need too much education to make descent salary.

pros:
Solid part time pay for some.
Most of the time it is not too busy
You meet cool people
cons:
A lot of information and responsibilities
Grim outlook for promotion
Few raises
People can be very rude or confrontational
Saturdays 
NO OVERTIME

job_title: GRE Prep Teacher in Miami, FL
pros: Good pay, steady work, contributing to the education of people who may not otherwise be able to seek it
cons: Parking is troublesome, but otherwise no cons

job_title: Network Services Technician in Miami, FL
pros: Friendly environment, co workers and staff are one of the nicest people I have met and it makes ou feel at ease and appreciated
cons: No downsides so far as the campus is good to work at

pros: Days off. Good benefits. Salary is decent. It all depends on which department and campus you work for. Excellent training and development.
cons: Very political environment. Managers are not great at communication.  Employees sometimes left in the dark about priorities and projects.

review_title: It's a stepping stone to better things.
job_title: Front Desk Clerk in Miami, FL
pros: Works with your school schedule, Provides decent pay if you don't have any bills.
cons: Management was terrible, if you have bills you better have two jobs. No room for promotion, favoritism.

review_title: Convenient if you're studying at the college
pros: Friendly coworkers, convenience of attending school while working there, getting to know professors/ higher division staff, understanding of taking time off.
cons: No benefits for part timers, lack of recognition, salary could be better for the amount of work put in

job_title: Mathematics Learning Assistant in Spotsylvania, VA
pros: Great work environment. I worked with truly wonderful people who made it a pleasure to go to work each day.
cons: Wish I could have had a full time job there, but those seem to be nearly impossible to come by.

pros: You'll learn a lot and the school actually provides a great service to the community at affordable prices.
cons: Poor pay, you have to learn to play politics, they'll work you to death, company culture is... like the movie Mean Girls

pros: Ability to achieve your education, to work a varied schedule and a fabulous place to be a working mother!
cons: The salary....That's about it. Maybe the insurance could be a little less expensive but all in all it isn't that bad.

pros: The benefits are great and it's Miami.
cons: It doesn't matter if you get an excellent review. Remember your contract is annual and you can be released at any time. Always keep your resume up-to-date.

job_title: Adult Education Tutor in Miami, FL
pros: Flexible Schedule and great interaction with the students.
cons: Working with adults who act like children is frustrating. Many policies put in place only hinder student success and enrollment.

pros: I was helpdesk tier 1. Mostly was an AD and exchange admin.  Allowed me to get career specific work well I was in school.
cons: I was unable to go fulltime without a bachelor's degree.

review_title: Adjunct faculty - Spanish language / ESL- foreign languages lab instructor (speech & writing)
pros: It's open to everyone. Good working conditions. Great workshop training.
cons: It's hard to get a full-time job.

job_title: Adjunct Faculty/Lab Instructor in Miami, FL
pros: I enjoy teaching, looking how my students learn and appreciate my work, that is the best thing in my life.
cons: Miami Dade College is the largest college in USA, I like working in such an important college

pros: Relative independence and I love the students!
cons: Not the most organized department and job security is non-existent.

review_title: Life as an Adjunct at MiamiDade College
job_title: Adjunct Professor of English in Miami, FL
pros: Nurturing environment for staff and students alike; school offers many resources.
cons:
Life for adjuncts at Miami Dade College is better than at many other 
institutions but, may of us-- including me-- want to be full-timers.

pros: The largest institution of higher education in the United States with more minorities earning Associate's Degrees than any other college.
cons: More is not always better. There are fluctuations in leadership and management styles.

job_title: Assistant Professor, Spanish in Kendall, FL
pros: I know they have many students wanting to learn Spanish
cons: To be the best Spanish teacher. I know students that are not very happy with the Spanish teachers  at the College

pros: Excellent place to work. Excellent resources do work with students. Good computer and simulation labs
cons: Some semesters the part time faculty dont get courses assigned as the full time staff have priority of assignment

pros: Diverse population, innovative faculty, insurance benefits for employee at no cost,
cons: Overworked faculty (required summer semesters), no raise in overload pay since 1997,  no funds for professional development travel/conferences

review_title: Miami Dade College is a Wonderful Place to Work
job_title: Reading, Writing, and Speech Tutor in Miami, FL
pros: Great people to work with, positive work environment (lovely campus), inspiring to work with students.
cons: Pay per hour for part time workers without a Bachelor's Degree is low.

pros: Good place to work and build friendships. Extremely flexible work schedule, along with good management which makes it easier for everyone.
cons: The only downside will be the somewhat low salary.

review_title: Miami Dade West Campus at Doral is a good opportunity to expand the knowledge of various cultures through students.
pros: Connecting with foreign students; learn about the different cultures
cons: As a part-timer there are no benefits; working hard without rewards

pros: There are plenty of jobs available and there is nothing stopping you from applying.
cons: Frigid, tyrannical, corporate environment with drab buildings and offices.

pros: Benefits are really good and get so much time off!
cons: Strong politics, management is more important.. unfair treatment.

job_title: Instructor, College Or University in Miami, FL
pros: Great Work environment and very flexible
cons: no health or dental benefits, and very little pay for the level of education most instructors provide.

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Miami, FL
pros: Phones, Customer service skills, data entry, filing, team leader, pleasant personality, motivated, great mathematic skills and prompt.
cons: No Cons I Am A Team Player

pros: Convenience of flexible hours and the benefit of working close to school and classes.
cons: Only works on data entry experience but not on service nor any other primary need for future career paths.

pros: Really easy work experience, set schedule per semester, works with your school schedule
cons: The pay was too low for me

pros: A great environment, super flexible, and with helpful people that are able to always help you.
cons: Extremely difficult.. almost impossible... to get a full time position.

pros: An overall relaxing work environment, very easy to get along, and communicate with colleagues and professors.
cons: Sometimes required to do administrative for students, such and study planning, guidance etc.

pros: Very nice rehearsal facilities and state-of-the-art technology.
cons: Bad competition between Community Ed and the Music Department.

pros: One of the best college in usa. Good working conditions and professional services.
cons: Good payment but a few hours

job_title: ESOL and FTCE Adjunct Professor in Miami, FL
pros: Everyone was very helpful and as an Adjunct I was given all opportunities to advance.
cons: Varying schedule but besides that, there weren't other Cons I can think about.

job_title: Talent Employment Solutions Consultant in Raleigh, NC
pros: I loved the flexibility of my schedule and being able to create my own curriculum.
cons: They limit the hours that you can work per week to a maximum of 25 hours.

pros: Good hours, enjoyable coworkers, nice campus, beautiful office, fun work
cons: Poor salary, no reviews, no merit raises,

review_title: My time spent with Miami Dade College
pros: Friendly Co-workers and  friendly  supervisors
cons: I had a hard time finding personnel to cover my hours if I needed time off for personal reasons.

pros: great atmosphere and benefits, plus a flexible schedules
cons: hard to grow, once you get a job, it is very hard to move to another position

pros: Great environment, all federal holidays off, two weeks off during Fall recess + vacation days.
cons: Dirty old buildings with dirty old restrooms.

pros: Very relaxed environment. Flexible schedule for students. You can do your homework at work.
cons: Low pay. Students and parents can be rude.

pros: You will be exposed to thousands of opportunities that will change your life. Wonderful working environment.
cons: Sometimes objectives are not clearly stated and therefore, mistakes are easier to be committed

job_title: Information Specialist Miami in North Miami Beach, FL
pros: Great environment, awesome people. Flexible hours are great for a student.
cons: No real cons. the job can be tough at times, but it doesn't take away from the experience.

pros: Excellent in all areas of the system..
cons: Need improvement with the staff member in keeping the lines of communication open

pros: Great environment. Great co workers. Wonderful opportunities to learn. Easy job.
cons: Not too many opportunities to grow. Too many part times jobs

job_title: Front Desk Receptionist in Miami, FL
pros: Very hands on with students. Students will always come first. Very flexible schedules for employees who are also in school working o higher level education.
cons: Students override higher ups.

pros: Benefits, Stability and room for growth
cons: None, I have grown personally and professionally at Miami Dade College and am grateful for the opportunity to work here.

review_title: Student's first, employees, not so much
